statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Bryce Pressley scored 25 points and had five boards to lead Portland past Loyola Marymount 87-60 Monday night in the West Coast Conference opener for both squads.
article.headline: Portland upends Loyola Marymount in 87-60 victory
article.linkText: Portland upends Loyola Marymount in 87-60 victory
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. -- Bryce Pressley scored 25 points and had five boards to lead Portland past Loyola Marymount 87-60 Monday night in the West Coast Conference opener for both squads. Marin Mornar's dunk gave the Lions a 17-9 lead with 11:37 left in the first half. The play ignited Portland (7-7, 1-0), which used a 25-2 run to take control of the game. Pressley hit three 3-pointers and a layup during the run which lasted just more than eight minutes. Presley shot 7-for-13 from behind the 3-point arc. D'Marques Tyson hit a 3 just before the half ended to make it 46-26. After the break, Pressley hit a 3, Gabe Taylor scored a layup, Pressley hit two free throws and Alex Wintering's jumper pushed the lead to 55-31 with 16:39 to play. Brandon Brown scored 16 points and had six rebounds to lead Loyola Marymount (7-5, 0-1).
